medical_history.chief_complaint: Disturbance of consciousness, psychiatric symptoms, behavioral change, cognitive impairment, seizure, and hypotension.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presented with symptoms that began 11 days prior to admission, following a resection of the right colon. Initial psychiatric symptoms and seizures resolved one month after treatment, but cognitive impairment persisted. Seven months later, the patient was readmitted with progressive head and trunk tremors, dysarthria, and gait instability for over 1 month. No improvement or deterioration of neurological symptoms was noted 3 months after the second admission.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Appendiceal goblet cell carcinoma diagnosed after colon resection; no other relevant medical history specified.
medical_history.social_history: Exposure to toxic substances was denied.
